festivals.description: Marks the transition of the Sun into Capricorn, celebrated with kite flying, sesame sweets, and holy dips.

celebrations.name: Kite Flying
celebrations.details: People fly kites, symbolizing the ascent of the sun.

celebrations.name: Holy Dip
celebrations.details: Pilgrims take a dip in holy rivers for purification.

historical_significance.details: Marks the beginning of longer days as per Hindu astronomy.

festivals.description: Celebration of Goddess Saraswati, the goddess of wisdom, learning, and arts.

celebrations.name: Saraswati Puja
celebrations.details: Students and artists worship Goddess Saraswati for knowledge and wisdom.

celebrations.name: Wearing Yellow
celebrations.details: People wear yellow clothes, symbolizing prosperity and energy.

historical_significance.details: Honors the goddess who grants wisdom and learning.

festivals.description: Dedicated to Lord Shiva, observed with fasting, night-long prayers, and chanting.

celebrations.name: Shiva Abhishek
celebrations.details: Devotees perform milk, honey, and water offerings to Shiva Lingam.

celebrations.name: Night Vigil
celebrations.details: Devotees stay awake all night chanting mantras.

historical_significance.details: This day marks the divine wedding of Shiva and Parvati.

festivals.description: Festival of colors celebrating the victory of good over evil, marking the arrival of spring.

celebrations.name: Color Throwing
celebrations.details: People throw colored powders and water at each other in celebration.

celebrations.name: Bonfires
celebrations.details: Holika Dahan (bonfire) is lit to symbolize the victory over evil.

historical_significance.details: Symbolizes the burning of Holika and the protection of devotee Prahlad by Lord Vishnu.

festivals.description: Celebrates the birth of Lord Rama, observed with prayers and readings from the Ramayana.

celebrations.name: Ramayana Recitations
celebrations.details: Devotees read and listen to the Ramayana.

celebrations.name: Temple Processions
celebrations.details: Idols of Lord Rama are taken on processions.

historical_significance.details: Marks the birth of Lord Rama, the seventh incarnation of Vishnu.

festivals.description: Commemorates the birth of Lord Hanuman, the ardent devotee of Lord Rama.

celebrations.name: Hanuman Chalisa Recitation
celebrations.details: Devotees chant Hanuman Chalisa for blessings.

celebrations.name: Prayers and Offerings
celebrations.details: Special offerings of sweets and flowers at temples.

historical_significance.details: Marks the birth of Hanuman, known for his devotion and strength.

festivals.description: Celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna, observed with fasting, devotional singing, and Dahi Handi.

celebrations.name: Midnight Puja
celebrations.details: Celebrated at midnight, the time of Krishna’s birth.

celebrations.name: Dahi Handi
celebrations.details: Teams form human pyramids to break a pot of curd.

historical_significance.details: Marks the birth of Lord Krishna, the eighth avatar of Vishnu.

festivals.description: Festival celebrating the birth of Lord Ganesha, observed with grand installations of Ganesha idols and processions.

celebrations.name: Ganesh Sthapana
celebrations.details: Installation of Ganesha idols in homes and public places.

celebrations.name: Visarjan
celebrations.details: Immersion of the idol in water bodies after the festival.

historical_significance.details: Goddess Parvati created Ganesha from clay.

festivals.description: Navaratri is a nine-day festival honoring Goddess Durga, culminating in Dussehra, which marks Lord Rama’s victory over Ravana.

celebrations.name: Durga Puja
celebrations.details: Idol worship, fasting, and cultural events.

celebrations.name: Ramlila
celebrations.details: Dramatic enactments of Lord Rama’s life leading to Ravana’s defeat.

historical_significance.details: Durga slew the demon Mahishasura after nine nights of battle.
Marks the triumph of good over evil.

festivals.description: Diwali, the festival of lights, symbolizes the victory of light over darkness and good over evil.

celebrations.name: Lakshmi Puja
celebrations.details: Dedicated to Goddess Lakshmi for prosperity and well-being.

celebrations.name: Govardhan Puja
celebrations.details: Honoring Lord Krishna lifting Govardhan Hill.

historical_significance.story: Return of Lord Rama to Ayodhya
historical_significance.details: Diwali marks Lord Rama’s return to Ayodhya after 14 years of exile.
